channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Russian Bombardment Causes Large Outages in Ukraine’s Big Cities

item.title: Maps: Tracking Typhoon Fung-wong

item.title: After 40 years, plans to deploy a new undersea habitat are in progress
item.description: A British engineering and research company is unveiling a "subsea human habitat," a base that four people can live and work in for missions of a week ...

item.title: Merck PCSK9 Pill Results Point to Extremely Low Cholesterol Future
item.description: The drug targets the PCSK9 protein, and could give millions of people a more affordable option to reduce their heart disease risk.

item.title: 4 dead, 11 injured after a car chased by police plows into a crowd outside Tampa bar
item.description: A deadly crash in Tampa's Ybor City neighborhood early Saturday morning has left four people dead and 11 injured.

item.title: Worries Increase on Second Day of Flight Cancellations
item.description: Disruptions to air travel on Saturday were modest, but officials and passengers were bracing for worse as the government shutdown continued.

item.title: Heavy Rain Expected in California After Spell of Unusually Warm Weather
item.description: Areas across the state could record anywhere from one to five or more inches of rain. The Sierra will get some snow.

item.title: Judge says Education Dept. partisan out-of-office emails violated First Amendment
item.description: A federal judge says the Trump administration "overplayed its hand" by inserting partisan language into workers' out-of-office autoreplies.

item.title: Anthony Grey, Journalist Held Hostage by China for Two Years, Dies at 87
item.description: A correspondent for Reuters, he became a global symbol of China’s isolation and of the anti-foreigner hysteria spawned by its Cultural Revolution.
